results.title: What have you done with my country
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Douglass Baglin and Cinetel Film Production Services
results.brief_description: Shows what has happened to the land of the first Australians since Europeans settled it. Includes readings from Kath Walker’s “We are going”, archival drawings of early European settlement, historical newsreel footage (Vietnam moratorium marches, mining and minerals boom, technological and industrial development etc.) Also emphasises the devastation to Australian ecological systems through man’s continual development of the natural environment for commercial gain. Photography by Douglass Baglin, narrated by Tim Elliott.

results.title: Surfing: the healing wave
results.creator_credit: Tim Burns, Huey Benjamin and Neugh Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: First Nations people come from all over Australia to compete in this unique and colorful event - the annual indigenous surfing contest at Fingal on the East Coast. Kyle Slabb, the narrator, is a young First Nations surfer who guides the viewer around the spectacular rivers and idyllic coastal reserves of his homelands, offering insights into traditional ways, dance and ceremony, and an understanding of his struggle to preserve these values in his modern life. The film is a lively and uplifting look at the positive steps taken by a First Nations community as it strives to achieve cultural continuity for future generations.

results.title: Camels and the Pitjantjara
results.creator_credit: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Shows the daily life of nomadic Central Australians of the Pitjantjara tribe who have acquired camels, guns and other modern equipment. Shows the capture of a wild camel and travels in the MacDonnell Range; hunting rabbits and living off the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

results.title: Journey into tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways and Fortune Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.
results.description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.

results.title: Man of Flowers
results.brief_description: Norman Kaye won the AFI’s best actor award for this stunning portrayal of Charles Bremer, a strange and sensitive man, whose sensual appreciation of all things beautiful led to his bizarre and erotic relationship with a young bi-sexual named Lisa. “Man of Flowers” is both erotic and richly amusing with a tragic after glow.

results.title: Yolngu boy
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Gordon Glenn, Patricia Edgar, Burrundi Pictures and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Caught in a collision between the modern world of rap, football, and street cred and the oldest living culture on earth, Lorrpu, Botj and Milika are three Yolngu teenagers who once shared a childhood dream of becoming great hunters together. But things have changed and their paths are diverging. Botj is walking on the wild side, a lost soul in search of a place to belong. Milika is more interested in football and girls than any of the traditional knowledge he is being taught. Only Lorrpu seems to care about the dream any more. Their paths are diverging, and he is the only one who can see it.

When Botj goes too far and finds himself on the wrong side of both black and white laws, Lorrpu must weigh up his own future against saving his friend.

He persuades the boys to trek to Darwin to argue Botj’s case with Dawu, a tribal leader. Leaving behind their community, they journey through the unforgiving wilderness of north-east Arnhem Land to Darwin. To survive, Lorrpu, Milika and Botj must draw on the ancient bush knowledge they were taught as boys and, most importantly, the bonds of their friendship.

Yolngu Boy is about the search for identity, making the journey from adolescence to adulthood and the implications of belonging to a larger social group, whether it is a culture, a family or a group of friends.

results.title: Drift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and black and white, silent
results.brief_description: Since the first Apollo moon landing in the 1960s, NASA has compiled an enormous photographic record of its lunar saga. San Francisco photographer Michael Light gained access to the original negatives, presenting his collection of photography in major American and European museums including San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. As a reprise to his photographic exhibition ‘Full Moon’, Light has created ‘Drift’, an epic seven-minute loop of composite still imagery taken during NASA’s moon missions.
results.description: Since the first Apollo moon landing in the 1960s, NASA has compiled an enormous photographic record of its lunar saga. San Francisco photographer Michael Light gained access to the original negatives, presenting his collection of photography in major American and European museums including San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. As a reprise to his photographic exhibition ‘Full Moon’, Light has created ‘Drift’, an epic seven-minute loop of composite still imagery taken during NASA’s moon missions.

results.title: Mapping a city of fragments v.2
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Using the opening of Godard’s film ‘Alphaville’ as a foundation, Lord constructs a vision of the evolving global city during the last years of the 20th Century. Structured as a series of repetitions, the montage of the changing city is offset by shots of Silicon Valley corporate facades. The result is a dialectical contrast between urban and suburban space, body and mind, chaos and order, and the post-modern and the modern. Shot in Hi-8 video in Tokyo, Fukuoka City, Mexico City, Rome, San Francisco, Naples and Los Angeles.

results.title: Gumboots Australia for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. One 3 1/2 inch floppy disk and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the player’s quest to solve the case.

results.title: Emulation of Gumboots Australia for PC
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. One 3 1/2 inch floppy disk and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the player’s quest to solve the case.
results.description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the player’s quest to solve the case.
